newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil slips, weather/supply shaves premiums.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil slips, weather/supply shaves premiums.

text.p: NWE gas oil fell on easier futures on Tuesday and premiums for Russian heating oil and winter grade diesel weakened on more supply and balmy weather, traders said.
Nov IPE ended $3.50 lower at $230.75, depressed by news that Colonial pipeline said it had received a surge in heating oil orders for the next 40 days and by mild European autmun weather.

A cargo of lower suphur diesel winter grade (-7/-22) was traded at Nov IPE +26.50 cif NWE for prompt delivery, about $4 lower than Monday, shaving the differential to heating oil to around $20 from around $24 and $25 last week.
"It's kind of a disaster (for sellers). It must be just the weather, because stocks are still low," said one trader.
"Low sulphur (diesel) is definitely less tight than before... refineries are catching up on production," another said.

On the barge market, traders reported a parcel of intermediate grade (-3/-13) traded for Nov IPE +$35, unchanged to slightly firmer than on Monday. A parcel of prompt refinery grade heating oil was traded for Nov IPE +2, unchanged.
Barge traders said more supply made buyers hard to find and predicted premiums for both heating oil and diesel would weaken.
